title: Color Information-Based Automated Mask Generation for Detecting Underwater Atypical Glare Areas
author: Mingyu Jeon (Kongju National University), Yeonji Paeng (Kongju National University), Sejin Lee (Kongju National University), ...
relevance_why: The methods of image processing and unsupervised clustering offer insights that could influence audio event detection, particularly in obscuring the effects of noise, which may have parallels in underwater acoustic environments.
background: The task involves detecting underwater breath bubbles in real-time using image analysis without extensive data labeling.
contribution: [Color Information-Based Automated Mask Generation for Detecting Underwater Atypical Glare Areas] introduces a K-means clustering algorithm combined with color space fusion and spatial information to effectively isolate bubbles in underwater imaging, achieving significant clustering accuracy.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods mainly relied on supervised learning approaches requiring extensive annotated datasets, which are impractical in dynamic underwater settings.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves efficiency by utilizing an unsupervised method that leverages spatial and color data to detect glare without relying on large training datasets.

key_innovation: The combination of relative spatial coordinates with multiple color spaces enhances the robustness of underwater glare detection.
real_world_impact: This approach could improve safety in diving operations by providing timely alerts to divers about potential equipment failures or hazardous conditions in real-time.
limitations: The performance is influenced by dataset domain similarity, which may restrict generalization across different underwater environments.

new_terms.K-means clustering: **K-means clustering** is an unsupervised learning algorithm that partitions data into K distinct clusters based on feature similarity.
new_terms.CLAHE: **Contrast Limited Adaptive Histogram Equalization** is a technique used to enhance image contrast by applying histogram equalization on localized regions of an image.
